document_title: Arm lymphedema: Causes, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Depending on the severity, the signs of the disease are also different. Arm lymphedema often has the following symptoms:
Swelling of all or part of the arm; Pain, heaviness; The infection recurs many times.; The affected skin area is hard and thickened.
These symptoms range from mild to severe. In severe cases, the size of the fingers and toes changes, and even makes it difficult to use.
subsection_title: phu bach huyet canh tay.json. Symptoms of arm lymphedema
